SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: These requirements emphasize compliance with privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR) and secure data handling, ensuring user data is protected and shared only with explicit consent.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-007-NFR-001 and P-006-NFR-002 focus on user control and transparency in data usage, while P-002-NFR-002 and P-001-FR-003 specifically highlight secure storage and encryption. P-003-FR-002 broadens the scope to include all privacy settings and legal adherence.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Comprehensive Data Privacy and Security
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system shall ensure all data collection, storage, and sharing comply with privacy regulations (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR), implement robust security protocols including encryption, and provide users with clear options to control their data and maintain transparency in data usage.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: These requirements focus on providing secure and encrypted communication channels for caregivers and healthcare providers to ensure privacy and confidentiality.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-006-FR-003 specifically mentions interactions with clients' family members, while P-004-FR-002 emphasizes coordination with patients and other healthcare providers.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Secure Communication for Caregivers and Providers
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system must provide secure and encrypted communication channels for caregivers, healthcare providers, and clients' family members to ensure privacy and confidentiality in all interactions.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: These requirements emphasize traceability and auditability of user actions and data access to support compliance and regulatory requirements.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: P-003-FR-003 specifically mentions maintaining an audit trail for data access and privacy settings, while P-003-NFR-001 broadens the scope to include all user actions and system responses.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Audit Trail and Traceability
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system must maintain a detailed audit trail of all user and system interactions, including data access and changes to privacy settings, with no auto-deletion of logs, to support compliance audits and regulatory requirements.

SimilarGroups.SimilarityNote: This requirement focuses on strict access control mechanisms to prevent unauthorized data access.
SimilarGroups.DifferenceNote: It specifically prioritizes compliance settings over user or developer preferences, which is not addressed in other requirements.

UnifiedRequirement.Name: Strict Access Control
UnifiedRequirement.Description: The system must enforce strict access control mechanisms, prioritizing compliance settings over user or developer preferences to prevent unauthorized data access.

Conflicts.Note: P-007-NFR-001 emphasizes user control and transparency, which may conflict with P-003-NFR-002's strict access control that prioritizes compliance over user preferences. This creates a trade-off between user-friendly customization and stringent security measures.

Both requirements focus on secure communication channels, but P-006-FR-003 includes interactions with clients' family members, while P-004-FR-002 emphasizes coordination with patients and healthcare providers. This could lead to divergence in implementation details based on user personas.
